channel.title: How do i fix this
channel.description:
first off, sorry im posting so much...
now, is there any way to get rid of the other lines besides making 100 different sendQuest things... btw delta 317
[IMG]http://i1062.photobucket.com/albums/t499/202685/1-3.png[/img]

item.title: How do i fix this
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

oh… lol u used the right java capitialization, it made it look like a legit method… lol startStringId

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix this
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

202685:

well i get errors when i use that…

That’s because you are NOT supposed to use that. It’s a placeholder, nothing more and nothing else. You replace it with the actual Ids for the strings.

I repeat, you do NOT use startStringId or endStringId, that is a placeholder for you to put the number in. DO NOT use that.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix this
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

202685:

can i have the methods for the start and end things??

Those are merely placeholders. There are NO methods. I simply put that there to show you that you would have to put the string Ids in there…

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix this
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

        public void logIn() {
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                        sendQuest("", i);
                }
                sendQuest("Welcome To PkzzScape", 8147);
                sendQuest("This Server Is Ment For Pking And Skilling :P", 8148);
                sendQuest("Owners Are Zach And Robert!", 8149);
                sendQuest("---------------------------------------------------------------------------", 8150);
                sendQuestSomething(8143);
                showInterface(8134);
                flushOutStream();
        }

It doesn’t matter how many of those you have, yes, you just put it in the method.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix this
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

[quote=“202685, post:5, topic:438263”]public void logIn() { sendQuest("Welcome To PkzzScape", 8147); sendQuest("This Server Is Ment For Pking And Skilling :P", 8148); sendQuest("Owners Are Zach And Robert!", 8149); sendQuest("---------------------------------------------------------------------------", 8150); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }

i just use that, btw i tried putting that code ther but i dont have the methods[/quote]

	public void logIn() {
                for(int i = startStringId; i <= endStringId; i++) {
                	sendQuest("", i);
                }
                sendQuest("Welcome To PkzzScape", 8147);
                sendQuest("This Server Is Ment For Pking And Skilling :P", 8148);
                sendQuest("Owners Are Zach And Robert!", 8149);
                sendQuest("---------------------------------------------------------------------------", 8150);
                sendQuestSomething(8143);
                showInterface(8134);
                flushOutStream();
        }

You don’t need any methods, all we’re using is a simple for statement in java. The only thing I can think of you thinking you needing a method for is the “startStringId” and “endStringId”, you don’t leave those, you will have to put in the actual Id numbers.

http://leepoint.net/notes-java/flow/loops/foreach.html

Read full topic
